meanings.definition: An abnormality in the tissue of an organism, typically caused by disease or injury.
meanings.sent1: The doctor found a small lesion on the patient's skin during the examination.
meanings.sent2: The lesion on the leaf was caused by a tiny insect.
meanings.sent3: The lesion on the tree bark looked like a tiny heart shape.
meanings.sent4: The lesion on the fruit made it look like it was crying sap.
meanings.sent5: The lesion on the rock was a bright red color, standing out against the gray stone.

meanings.definition: To cause damage to tissue through disease or injury.
meanings.sent1: The infection can lesion the skin if not treated promptly.
meanings.sent2: Accidentally hitting your knee can lesion the tissue underneath.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria seemed determined to lesion every part of the plant.
meanings.sent4: The harsh weather can lesion the delicate petals of the flower.
meanings.sent5: The constant rubbing can lesion the skin, leading to irritation.
